army

Class Army

  • java.lang.Object
    • army.Army

  • public class Army
extends java.lang.Object
    Army class manages a collection of Actor objects. The Army class does not need to know any detailed information about subclasses of Actor. Army takes responsibility for adding each avatar (a reference-toNode) to the Simulator (which inherits Group and Group maintains a list of child Node objects that are to be displayed on the Scene).
    Version:
    Lab Assignment 4: The Hobbit Battlefield Simulator
    Author:
    Rex Woollard
    See Also:
    Actor, ActorFactory, Simulator

    • Field Detail

      • name

        private java.lang.String name

      • collectionActors

        private javafx.collections.ObservableList<Actor> collectionActors
        Each Army object must have a Collection that can hold references to Actor objects. Currently, the Collection is implemented as an ArrayList

      • simulator

        private Simulator simulator
        The reference-to-Simulator gives the Army access to the list of child Node objects maintained by the Simulator (which inherits from Group). When avatars are added the reference-to-Simulator provides access to the Scene.

      • opposingArmy

        private Army opposingArmy

      • color

        private javafx.scene.paint.Color color
        Used to support the color of the DropShadow which is applied to each avatar.

      • dropShadow

        private javafx.scene.effect.DropShadow dropShadow
        An Effect that is applied to each Node object that expresses the avatar.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Army

        public Army(java.lang.String name,
            Simulator simulator,
            javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
        Constructor builds an Army object
        Parameters:
        name - is the String label for the Army.
        simulator - is a reference-to-Simulator that is captured by Army. It is used to gain access to the Group list of child Node objects. Army takes responsibility for adding each avatar to the Group.
        color - is used to define a DropShadow (a subclass of Effect) that is applied to each Node object that expresses the avatar. The DropShadow effect shows a visual representation of the Node allegiance to the Army.

    • Method Detail

      • getObservableListActors

        public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Actor> getObservableListActors()

      • getScene

        public javafx.scene.Scene getScene()

      • populate

        public void populate(ActorFactory.Type type,
                     int numToAdd)
        Creates the specified number of Actor objects, adding each new Actor object to the Collection. Additionally, each Actor object has a reference-to-Node for the avatar. That reference-to-Node value is added to the Group list of children (and Simuloatr is a kind of Group.
        Parameters:
        type - is an enum value which is a reference-to an ActorFactory.Type (such as HOBBITWIZARD, ORC, ELF or RANDOM. That reference-to-enum value is used to call the create() virtual method.
        numToAdd - is the number of objects to add to the Army.

      • display

        public void display()
        Outputs textual display to the console.

      • edit

        public boolean edit(int index)
        Used to edit a single Actor object in the Collection of Actor objects.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()

      • startMotion

        public void startMotion()
        Iterates through the Collection of Actor objects and instructs each to begin (or resume) motion (ultimately using TranslateTransition objects that define animated movement). The start maps to a call to play() for the TranslateTransition object.

      • suspendMotion

        public void suspendMotion()
        Iterates through the Collection of Actor objects and instructs each to suspend motion (ultimately using TranslateTransition objects that define animated movement). The suspend maps to a call to pause() for the TranslateTransition object.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
